title: KPLC Board of Directors — 165th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening and apologies; 2. Confirmation of minutes of 164th meeting; 3. CEO's report; 4. Q3 FY2024 financial results; 5. LMCP Phase III update; 6. FY2024 interim dividend recommendation; 7. EPRA tariff review status; 8. Board committee reports; 9. AOB
minutes: Board noted the Q3 FY2024 revenue of KES 15.1bn representing a 9.4% year-on-year increase. Discussion centred on power purchase cost management and acceleration of LMCP connections to rural areas. Board approved interim dividend of KES 350m.

resolutions.description: Board approved the Q3 FY2024 financial results as presented and directed management to maintain Q4 trajectory.
Board approved an interim dividend of KES 350,000,000 (KES 0.66 per share) payable to shareholders by 31 December 2023.
Board approved acceleration of 45,000 LMCP connections in Q4 FY2024 with supplementary budget of KES 480m funded from operating cashflow.
Board directed CEO to submit EPRA tariff review supplementary data within 14 days of receiving the regulator's information request dated 10 October 2024.

title: KPLC Board of Directors — 164th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Confirmation of minutes; 3. CEO report; 4. Q2 FY2024 financials; 5. Annual report and accounts FY2023 adoption; 6. External auditor appointment; 7. Board committee reports; 8. AOB
minutes: Board reviewed Q2 performance and adopted the FY2023 Annual Report. KPMG Kenya appointed as external auditors for FY2024 following competitive process. Safety statistics for H1 FY2024 tabled — 3 Lost Time Injuries recorded.

resolutions.description: Board adopted the FY2023 Annual Report and Financial Statements as audited by Deloitte Kenya.
Board appointed KPMG Kenya as external auditors for FY2024 at a fee not exceeding KES 42m.
Board approved the Q2 FY2024 financial results and noted continued improvement in collection efficiency.

title: KPLC Special Board Meeting — Tariff Review Strategy
agenda: 1. EPRA 2024 Tariff Review — Strategic approach and consultant appointment; 2. Regulatory advocacy framework; 3. Any other business
minutes: Board reviewed proposed tariff increase of 18% over regulatory period 2024-2027. Discussion on balancing revenue adequacy with consumer affordability. Board approved engagement of Navigant Consulting as regulatory advisors.

resolutions.description: Board approved appointment of Navigant Consulting as KPLC regulatory advisors for the EPRA 2024-2027 tariff review process at a fee not exceeding KES 85m.
Board approved the tariff review position paper targeting a 16% revenue requirement increase over the 2024-2027 regulatory period.

title: KPLC Board of Directors — 163rd Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Confirmation of minutes; 3. CEO report; 4. Q4 FY2023 financial results (preliminary); 5. FY2023 final dividend recommendation; 6. Strategic Plan progress review; 7. AOB
minutes: Full board attendance. Q4 results reviewed showing total FY2023 revenue of KES 58.5bn. Final dividend of KES 700m recommended pending audit completion. Strategic Plan 2023-2027 implementation progress reviewed — 65% of Year 1 targets achieved.

resolutions.description: Board noted the preliminary Q4 FY2023 financial results and directed management to finalise audit by 31 October 2023.
Board recommended a final dividend of KES 700,000,000 (KES 1.32 per share) for FY2023 subject to completion of audit and shareholder approval.
Board approved the Balanced Scorecard targets for FY2024 including revenue target of KES 62bn and new connections target of 180,000.

title: KPLC Audit and Risk Committee — 48th Meeting
agenda: 1. Q3 internal audit report; 2. External audit progress update; 3. Risk register review; 4. Cybersecurity incident report; 5. EPRA compliance update; 6. AOB
minutes: Committee reviewed internal audit findings with 12 high-priority recommendations. KPMG confirmed audit on track for completion by 30 September. Cybersecurity risk relating to CIS system patch escalated to full board.

resolutions.description: Committee approved the Q3 FY2024 internal audit report and directed management to address all high-priority findings within 60 days.
Committee recommended escalation of CIS cybersecurity vulnerability to full Board as a critical operational risk.
Committee approved the updated risk register incorporating 3 new risks and downgrading 2 risks following completion of mitigation actions.

title: Kenya Airways Board of Directors — 142nd Meeting
location: Kenya Airways HQ, Airport North Road, Nairobi
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Confirmation of minutes; 3. CEO report; 4. Q4 and FY2023 financial results; 5. Fleet disposal update; 6. Restructuring plan progress; 7. Government support package update; 8. AOB
minutes: FY2023 annual results reviewed — net loss reduced to KES 3.8bn from KES 5.2bn in FY2022. Fleet disposal of two 777-300ER aircraft progressing. KQ MRO subsidiary showing improved margins. Restructuring on track.

resolutions.description: Board adopted the FY2023 financial results and directed CFO to finalise audit for publication by 30 April 2024.
Board deferred FY2023 final dividend, noting the company's negative equity position, and directed management to prioritise debt reduction.
Board noted the progress of fleet disposal and directed completion of sale of 5Y-KZD and 5Y-KZE by 31 May 2024.
Board approved the FY2025 budget framework with revenue target of KES 48bn and operating loss target of no more than KES 1.5bn.

title: Kenya Airways Board of Directors — 141st Meeting
location: Kenya Airways HQ, Airport North Road, Nairobi
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Minutes of 140th meeting; 3. CEO report; 4. Q3 2023 financial results; 5. Fleet renewal business case preliminary discussion; 6. JamboJet subsidiary review; 7. AOB
minutes: Q3 results improved with KES 12.8bn revenue. Fleet renewal business case presented for initial review — final decision deferred to Finance Committee. JamboJet domestic routes showing KES 1.2bn revenue contribution.

resolutions.description: Board approved Q3 2023 financial results and noted progressive improvement towards FY2023 targets.
Board referred the Fleet Renewal Business Case to the Finance and Strategy Committee for detailed review and recommendation.
Board approved continuation of JamboJet operations and directed inclusion of JamboJet in KQ Group strategic planning.

title: Kenya Airways Special Board Meeting — Government Restructuring Package
agenda: 1. Government equity injection proposal — KES 15bn; 2. Debt restructuring terms; 3. Appointment of restructuring advisor; 4. Communication strategy; 5. AOB
minutes: Government equity injection of KES 15bn approved to strengthen balance sheet. KCB Bank and Standard Bank debt restructuring agreed. Rothschild & Co appointed as restructuring advisors. Board endorsed communication to NSE.

resolutions.description: Board approved acceptance of KES 15,000,000,000 government equity injection via conversion of existing government-guaranteed debt to equity.
Board approved the debt restructuring terms with KCB Bank and Standard Bank extending repayment schedules by 5 years.
Board appointed Rothschild & Co as independent financial advisor for the restructuring process at a fee not exceeding KES 120m.

title: Kenya Airways Board of Directors — 140th Meeting
location: Kenya Airways HQ, Airport North Road, Nairobi
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. H1 2023 financial results; 3. Fleet disposal — Boeing 777 discussion; 4. New routes approval; 5. Collective Bargaining Agreement update (KAWU); 6. AOB
minutes: H1 revenue of KES 20.7bn with improved load factor of 76%. Board approved disposal of two Boeing 777-300ER aircraft and authorised two new routes to Kinshasa and Dar es Salaam. CBA negotiation with KAWU ongoing.

resolutions.description: Board approved disposal of 5Y-KZD and 5Y-KZE Boeing 777-300ER aircraft through competitive tender process with reserve price of USD 35m each.
Board approved commencement of Nairobi–Kinshasa and Nairobi–Dar es Salaam routes from 1 November 2023 subject to regulatory approvals.
Board endorsed the CBA negotiation framework providing for a 12% salary increase over 3 years, subject to affordability provisions.

title: KPA Board of Directors — 198th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Confirmation of minutes; 3. MD's report; 4. FY2023 annual results adoption; 5. Final dividend declaration; 6. Berths 25-26 project approval; 7. Port community system upgrade; 8. AOB
minutes: FY2023 record results adopted — KES 40.5bn revenue, KES 8.2bn net profit. Final dividend of KES 4.1bn approved payable to National Treasury. Berths 25-26 construction project approved with a budget of KES 28bn.

resolutions.description: Board adopted the FY2023 Annual Report and Financial Statements as audited by PricewaterhouseCoopers Kenya.
Board declared a final dividend of KES 4,100,000,000 payable to the National Treasury by 30 June 2024.
Board approved the Berths 25-26 construction project at a total budget of KES 28,000,000,000 to be funded from retained earnings (40%) and long-term debt (60%).
Board approved the Port Community System (PCS) Phase 2 upgrade contract award to Navis N4 at a cost of KES 1.8bn.

title: KPA Board of Directors — 197th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Confirmation of minutes; 3. Q1 FY2024 financial results; 4. Interim dividend — FY2024; 5. Berths 21-24 commissioning report; 6. Staff establishment review; 7. AOB
minutes: Full board attendance. Q1 FY2024 showed strong performance with 305,000 TEU throughput. Berths 21-24 commissioning report accepted — all four berths fully operational. Interim dividend of KES 2.05bn approved.

resolutions.description: Board approved Q1 FY2024 financial results and noted record throughput performance.
Board declared an interim dividend of KES 2,050,000,000 for FY2024 payable to the National Treasury by 15 December 2023.
Board accepted the commissioning report for Berths 21-24 and approved commercial operations commencement from 1 December 2023.

title: KPA Special Board Meeting — Lamu Port Expansion
agenda: 1. Lamu Port LAPSSET Corridor Berth 3 commissioning; 2. LAPSSET Authority coordination; 3. Environmental monitoring compliance; 4. Revenue projections; 5. AOB
minutes: Lamu Port Berth 3 commissioning approved following completion of NEMA compliance verification. Revenue projections of KES 2.8bn per annum from Berth 3 endorsed. LAPSSET coordination protocol updated.

resolutions.description: Board approved commencement of commercial operations at Lamu Port Berth 3 effective 1 August 2023.
Board endorsed the LAPSSET Corridor coordination protocol and directed MD to execute the updated MOU with LAPSSET Development Authority.
Board approved the environmental monitoring and mangrove replanting plan for Lamu as required by NEMA licence conditions.

title: KPA Board of Directors — 196th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. H1 FY2024 financial results; 3. Berths 21-24 construction progress; 4. Human resources — collective bargaining update (DOWU); 5. ISO recertification; 6. AOB
minutes: H1 FY2024 revenue of KES 19.3bn on track for annual target. Berths 21-24 97% complete. DOWU (Dock Workers Union of Kenya) CBA negotiations concluded — 14% wage increase over 2 years agreed. ISO 9001 recertification confirmed.

resolutions.description: Board approved the H1 FY2024 financial results and endorsed the full-year revenue forecast of KES 40bn.
Board ratified the CBA agreement with Dock Workers Union of Kenya (DOWU) providing for 14% wage increase over FY2024-2025.
Board noted the ISO 9001:2015 recertification by Bureau Veritas and directed management to pursue ISO 14001 environmental certification by June 2025.

title: KPLC Board of Directors — 162nd Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Q3 FY2023 financial results; 3. LMCP Phase III progress; 4. Pre-paid metering rollout; 5. Employee safety statistics; 6. AOB
minutes: Q3 FY2023 revenue of KES 44.1bn year-to-date, on track. LMCP Phase III at 68% completion — 155,000 of 230,000 targeted connections made. Pre-paid metering reached 4.2 million customers.

resolutions.description: Board approved Q3 FY2023 financial results and endorsed year-end revenue forecast of KES 58bn.
Board approved acceleration of LMCP Phase III to complete all 230,000 connections by 30 June 2023.
Board endorsed the pre-paid smart metering expansion programme targeting 5 million customers by December 2024.

title: Kenya Airways Finance and Strategy Committee — 62nd Meeting
location: Kenya Airways HQ, Airport North Road, Nairobi
agenda: 1. Fleet renewal business case detailed review; 2. FY2024 budget revision; 3. Codeshare revenue analysis; 4. AOB
minutes: Fleet Renewal Business Case reviewed in detail. NPV of KES 18.5bn over 10 years computed. Committee recommended approval subject to government guarantees. FY2024 budget revised upward to KES 47bn revenue.

resolutions.description: Committee recommended to the full Board approval of the Fleet Renewal Business Case for 12 B787-9 and 8 Embraer E2 aircraft, subject to securing government guarantees for financing.
Committee approved the revised FY2024 budget with revenue target of KES 47bn and EBITDA of KES 2.8bn.

title: KPA Board of Directors — 195th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. H2 FY2023 financial results; 3. FY2022 final dividend confirmation; 4. Strategic Plan mid-term review; 5. Staff establishment approval; 6. AOB
minutes: Full board attendance. H2 FY2023 strong performance confirmed. Final dividend of KES 3.55bn for FY2022 remitted to Treasury. Strategic Plan mid-term review showed throughput ahead of target by 8%.

resolutions.description: Board confirmed remittance of FY2022 final dividend of KES 3,550,000,000 to the National Treasury on 2 May 2023.
Board approved the Strategic Plan mid-term review and revised throughput target to 1.32 million TEUs for FY2024 (up from 1.25 million).
Board approved creation of 250 new positions in Marine Operations and Equipment Maintenance following berth expansion.

title: KPLC Human Resources and Remuneration Committee — 35th Meeting
agenda: 1. CEO performance contract review FY2024; 2. Senior management remuneration benchmarking; 3. Training and development budget FY2025; 4. Gender and diversity report; 5. AOB
minutes: CEO performance contract scored 87% for FY2024 — Exceeds Expectations. Senior management pay benchmarked against SOE peer group and private sector. Training budget of KES 580m approved for FY2025.

resolutions.description: Committee approved CEO performance rating of 87% (Exceeds Expectations) for FY2024 with corresponding performance bonus.
Committee approved FY2025 training and development budget of KES 580,000,000 representing 1.0% of payroll costs.
Committee set a gender diversity target of 40% female representation in senior management by FY2027 and directed HR to develop an action plan.

title: Kenya Airways Board of Directors — 139th Meeting
location: Kenya Airways HQ, Airport North Road, Nairobi
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Q1 2023 financial results; 3. Restructuring plan progress; 4. KAWU CBA negotiations; 5. FY2022 annual results adoption; 6. AOB
minutes: Q1 2023 revenue of KES 9.5bn with load factor improving to 74%. FY2022 annual results adopted — net loss of KES 5.2bn. KAWU (Kenya Aviation Workers Union) CBA negotiations at advanced stage.

resolutions.description: Board adopted the FY2022 Annual Report and Financial Statements.
Board endorsed the Restructuring Plan Phase 2 milestones and directed CEO to achieve EBITDA positivity by Q3 2024.
Board approved CBA framework with KAWU providing for 10% salary increase and improved welfare benefits over 3 years.

title: KPA Board of Directors — 199th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. Q4 FY2024 and Annual financial results; 3. Performance Contract FY2024/25 signing; 4. Berths 25-26 project commencement; 5. Blue Economy strategy alignment; 6. AOB
minutes: FY2024 results: revenue KES 42.1bn, net profit KES 8.7bn — both records. Performance Contract signed with CS Transport. Berths 25-26 groundbreaking ceremony scheduled for September 2024.

resolutions.description: Board adopted the FY2024 Annual Report and Financial Statements as audited by PricewaterhouseCoopers Kenya.
Board approved the FY2024/25 Performance Contract targets and authorised the MD to execute the contract with CS Transport.
Board approved commencement of Berths 25-26 construction with groundbreaking in September 2024 and completion target of December 2027.
Board approved the interim dividend of KES 2,200,000,000 for FY2024/25 payable to the National Treasury by 20 December 2024.

title: KPLC Board of Directors — 166th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. FY2024 preliminary annual results; 3. New MD appointment update; 4. Green energy transition plan; 5. Digital transformation progress; 6. AOB
minutes: FY2024 preliminary results show revenue of KES 62.1bn — 6.2% above FY2023. New MD appointment process underway. Green energy transition plan targeting 100% renewable supply by 2035 presented to board.

resolutions.description: Board noted the FY2024 preliminary results and directed CFO to finalise audit by 30 September 2024.
Board approved the Green Energy Transition Plan 2024-2035 as a strategic framework and directed integration into the Strategic Plan.
Board approved the Digital Transformation Programme budget of KES 2.8bn for FY2025 covering customer portal, smart grid systems, and ERP upgrade.

title: Kenya Airways Board of Directors — 143rd Meeting
location: Kenya Airways HQ, Airport North Road, Nairobi
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. H1 2024 financial results; 3. Fleet renewal progress update; 4. Route network performance; 5. Cargo division strategy; 6. AOB
minutes: H1 2024 revenue of KES 23.5bn on track for annual target. Boeing 787 lease agreement terms finalised with Air Lease Corporation. Cargo division recorded best H1 performance — KES 4.2bn revenue.

resolutions.description: Board approved H1 2024 financial results and noted improved EBITDA of KES 1.4bn.
Board approved the Boeing 787-9 operating lease agreement with Air Lease Corporation for 4 aircraft at USD 1.2m per aircraft per month.
Board approved the Cargo Strategy 2024-2028 targeting cargo revenue of KES 12bn by 2028.

title: KPLC Board of Directors — 161st Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. H1 FY2023 financial results; 3. System reliability report (SAIDI/SAIFI); 4. Safety review; 5. Supplier payment backlog; 6. AOB
minutes: H1 FY2023 revenue of KES 27.9bn. SAIDI improved to 38 hours — reduction from 52 hours in H1 FY2022. Supplier payment backlog of KES 12.5bn discussed with plan to reduce to KES 6bn by year-end.

resolutions.description: Board approved H1 FY2023 results and endorsed CEO plan to reduce technical losses to below 18% by FY2024.
Board approved supplier payment plan to reduce backlog from KES 12.5bn to KES 6bn by 30 June 2023 using operational cash flows.
Board approved SAIDI improvement target of 35 hours for FY2024 and directed investment in distribution automation in Nairobi Metro area.

title: KPA Audit Committee — 40th Meeting
agenda: 1. Q2 FY2024 internal audit report; 2. External audit plan FY2024; 3. Procurement compliance review; 4. IT audit — port community system; 5. AOB
minutes: Internal audit identified 8 medium-risk findings mainly in procurement. PwC presented audit plan for FY2024. PCS audit identified minor access control gaps — remediation in progress. Overall control environment rated Good.

resolutions.description: Committee approved the Q2 FY2024 internal audit report and directed management to address medium-risk findings within 90 days.
Committee approved the PwC FY2024 external audit plan and confirmed independence requirements met.

title: Kenya Airways Audit and Risk Committee — 55th Meeting
location: Kenya Airways HQ, Airport North Road, Nairobi
agenda: 1. EY audit findings FY2023; 2. Revenue leakage risk — code-share settlements; 3. IT risk assessment; 4. Fuel hedging risk; 5. AOB
minutes: EY presented 5 high-risk audit findings including revenue leakage in code-share settlements estimated at KES 320m. IT system risks flagged. Fuel hedging coverage expiry noted as critical risk.

resolutions.description: Committee directed management to implement remediation plan for code-share settlement reconciliation within 45 days.
Committee directed CFO to renew fuel hedging programme covering at least 50% of fuel consumption for H2 2024 within 30 days.
Committee escalated fuel hedging coverage gap to the full Board as a critical financial risk per risk escalation policy.

title: KPA Board of Directors — 194th Meeting
agenda: 1. Opening; 2. H1 FY2023 financial results; 3. Berths 21-24 construction update; 4. Tariff review proposal; 5. Regional ports strategy; 6. AOB
minutes: H1 FY2023 revenue of KES 18.5bn. Berths 21-24 construction at 45% completion. Port tariff proposal for 8% increase in FY2024 reviewed and approved for submission to Ministry of Transport.

resolutions.description: Board approved H1 FY2023 results and noted strong throughput performance of 635,000 TEUs.
Board approved port tariff increase proposal of 8% for FY2024 and directed MD to submit to Ministry of Transport for approval.
Board approved engagement of Dar es Salaam Port Authority for regional corridor cooperation MOU.
